oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of Sidney Montagu to Sir Edward Montagu
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Montagu, Sidney
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Montagus were a family with roots in Northamptonshire. Edward Montagu (1563-1644) carried the title first Baron Montagu; Sir Charles was his younger brother. Sidney Montagu (d. 1644) was a member and bencher of the Middle Temple who served as master of Requests. In this letter dated 27 January 1612/13, Sidney writes to Edward describing the events surrounding the wedding of Princess Elizabeth to Frederick, Count Palatine, and the rates charged to Middle Temple members to fund the masque.
